subject: Re: [junit] OO formal testing methodology
msgSnippet: Did a quick search on formal testing methodology, found no applicable but this interesting test driven forum interface which is much better than Yahoo Group
messageBody:
Did a quick search on formal testing methodology, found no applicable
but this interesting test driven forum interface which is much better
than Yahoo Group and email ...

http://www.testdriven.com/modules/newbb/viewtopic.php?topic_id=1612&forum=7

--- "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbrains@...> wrote:

> Maly, Daniel wrote:
> >
> > Hi,
> >
> > This may not be the best user group for my post, but I believe the
> unit
> > testing experts will have an answer:
> >
> > I'm looking for a formal testing methodology/process to accompany
> and
> > precede our unit testing harness - on the development side of SDLC.
> An
> > approach that unifies requirements testing, software design testing
> and
> > implementation testing.
> >
> > Any information is very appreciated.
>
> Why are you looking for a methodology? I have had much more success
> by
> simply looking at the problems and searching for concrete techniques
> and
> the supporting principles that solve those problems and stop them
> from
> recurring.
>
> What problems are you trying to solve?
> --
> J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
> Diaspar Software Services
> http://www.diasparsoftware.com
> Author, JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
>
